title: What are some good resources for learning about computer networking? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are comfortable fixing simple computer issues, assemble and disassemble a computer then you can start by the CompTIA Network+ course. CompTIA Network+ is a vendor neutral networking certification that is trusted around the world. It validates the essential knowledge and skills needed to confidently design, configure, manage and troubleshoot any wired and wireless networks. CompTIA Network+ certified individuals are in-demand worldwide.  If you have no experience fixing computers then you should first start studding CompTIA A+ course. CompTIA A+ (A Plus) is an entry-level computer certification for PC computer service technicians. The exam is designed to certify the competency of entry-level PC computer service professionals in installing, maintaining, customizing, and operating personal computers.Jan 15, 2015  If you are interested in online training I suggest www.AlphaPrep.net (high quality / low cost). Get a book on Computer Networking,say "Computer Networks" by Andrew Tanenbaum. This will give you a good hold on basics of computer networks. Use an Linux Machine to know basic network commands, and do some practical exercise playing around them. You can do a sample Client-Server Chat Room assignment to strengthen your knowledge about sockets,sessions, messaging, packet structure etc. Then you can move on to learn about FTP,SMTP,HTTP etc and go on. You can pick up a specific layer in TCP/IP stack and keep honing your knowledge on it, before moving to the next layer.
